@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The is a template class which can be used for HTML templating. In fact, this is a wrapper for mustache.js which is a "framework-agnostic way to render logic-free views". Here is a basic example how to use it: Template: 

 var template = "Hi, my name is {{name}}!";
 var view = {name: "qooxdoo"};
 qx.bom.Template.render(template, view);

For further details, please visit the mustache.js documentation here: https://github.com/janl/mustache.js/blob/master/README.md

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Original and only template method of mustache.js. For further documentation, please visit https://github.com/janl/mustache.js

@param.name: @param
@param.body: template {String} The String containing the template.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: view {Object} The object holding the data to render.
@param.description: The object holding the data to render.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: partials {Object} Object holding parts of a template.
@param.description: Object holding parts of a template.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Combines {@link #render} and {@link #get}. Input is equal to {@link #render} and output is equal to {@link #get}. The advantage over {@link #get} is that you don't need a HTML template but can use a template string and still get a DOM element. Keep in mind that templates can only have one root element.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: template {String} The String containing the template.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: view {Object} The object holding the data to render.
@param.description: The object holding the data to render.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: partials {Object} Object holding parts of a template.
@param.description: Object holding parts of a template.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Element} A DOM element holding the parsed template data.
@return.description: A DOM element holding the parsed template data.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper method which provides you with a direct access to templates stored as HTML in the DOM. The DOM node with the given ID will be used as a template, parsed and a new DOM node will be returned containing the parsed data. Keep in mind to have only one root DOM element in the the template. Additionally, you should not put the template into a regular, hidden DOM element because the template may not be valid HTML due to the containing mustache tags. We suggest to put it into a script tag with the type text/template.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} The id of the HTML template in the DOM.
@param.description: The id of the HTML template in the DOM.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: view {Object} The object holding the data to render.
@param.description: The object holding the data to render.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: partials {Object} Object holding parts of a template.
@param.description: Object holding parts of a template.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Element} A DOM element holding the parsed template data.
@return.description: A DOM element holding the parsed template data.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Accepts a parsed template and returns a (potentially nested) node.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: template {String} The String containing the template.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Element} A DOM element holding the parsed template data.
@return.description: A DOM element holding the parsed template data.
